body: If you call `asValue` on something that is not a value,  it is going to throw an exception. But many SugaredValues may have valid attributes (e.g. python_module.foo). So it is not safe to do this here. It would be a better idea to handle this inside of  `SimpleValue::attr` where it is guarenteed you have a value
body_html: If you call asValue on something that is not a value, it is going to throw an exception. But many SugaredValues may have valid attributes (e.g. python_module.foo). So it is not safe to do this here. It would be a better idea to handle this inside of SimpleValue::attr where it is guarenteed you have a value
